intro: Barteria stuhlmannii, commonly known as the red-stemmed barteria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, berry-like fruits. Barteria stuhlmannii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
